title.rendered: Meet the team at Stocks Hall

content.rendered:
As a family run company, Stocks Hall is all about people. Our residents, staff and management team are all part of the same caring community. Whilst we can’t show everyone who makes such a valuable contribution to the running of Stocks Hall, we’d like you to meet some of the dedicated and experienced personnel whose passion helps that community thrive…

the_team.name: Sue Lace
the_team.title: Director
the_team.description:
Stocks Hall Care Homes began trading in November 1987 and Sue has been employed by the company from the start. The care sector was a new experience for her, but throughout the last 20+ years she has gained a vast knowledge. She is extremely passionate about the care we provide and believes that the only way quality care can be achieved is by looking after the staff, and through continually developing & training employees at all levels.
For the past 10 years she has been a panel member for ‘Investors in People’ and since 2004 a panel member for ‘Work Life Balance’ with the Centre of Assessment. She is also the Chairman of the Lancashire Care Associate who are striving, in partnership with Lancashire County Council, to provide the people in Lancashire with the care and support they need.

the_team.name: Sam Potter
the_team.title: Operations Manager
the_team.description:
Sam has worked within the Care sector since being a young girl and has always been passionate about Quality of Care for All.
Initially coming to work for Stocks Hall in 1999, Sam managed the Homecare and Agency Services for just over 3 years. Following this, she worked in management positions within the Probation Service, Mental Health Team and Social Services.
In 2011 Sam returned to Stocks Hall to head up the Butterfly Project. This project centres on providing truly person centred care for people living within Stocks Hall.
Progressing on through the company, Sam is now in her current role of Operational Manager within The Stocks Hall Nursing & Care Group.

the_team.name: Faye Wilkinson
the_team.title: Care Home Manager
the_team.description: As a local girl originally from Preston, Faye has gained many years’ experience in Healthcare and the Public Health Sector working her way up to her current position as the Manager of our Stocks Hall Care Home here in the heart of Mawdesley. Faye joins us with first class experience from several managerial positions within various specialised care settings. A passion point for Faye is person centred care, positioning the people who choose to live with us at the heart of her approach to both managing a team and running our care home.

content.rendered:
If you really want to know about somewhere, it’s always best to talk to the people who live there. That’s why we’ve gathered together some testimonials from the people who live with us, so you can see what our residents have to say about Stocks Hall…

As from 2016, once our leisure suite is fully open, swimming and gym will also be on the timetable. content.rendered:
The location for Stocks Hall has been carefully chosen to offer our residents a wealth of local treasures. Set in the idyllic village location of Mawdesley, in the heart of the Lancashire countryside, Stocks Hall provides easy access to the surrounding community, shops, amenities and attractions.

Within a short five mile radius of Stocks Hall, you’ll find a wide range of things to see and do. Browse the Cedar Farm Galleries or wander through Heskin Hall Farmers Market before enjoying a delicious meal in one of the local country pubs. Try your hand at the local tennis and crown green bowling clubs, or see what’s on at the local WI and U3A.  Anglican, Methodists and Catholic Churches also play their part in this thriving community.

A village train station, nearby bus routes and ample parking make everything as convenient as possible for visiting family and friends. For residents, an exclusive Stocks Hall minibus is on hand catering for organised trips, essential errands and appointments.

two_boxes.description:
Cedar Farm

Less than a mile away from Stocks Hall Living you will find Cedar Farm, a delightful courtyard of independent shops, a cafe, and a deli selling local foods in converted farm buildings. With regular events and a monthly farmers market visit their website to find out more. View Cedar Farm

Mawdesley Tennis Club

Alongside the village hall, Mawdesley Tennis Club is set in a fantastic picturesque location. The club has 4 all-weather hardcourt floodlit courts allowing all-year round play, and a Club Pavilion with a decking area & changing rooms. View Tennis Club

three_boxes.description:
Heskin Farmers Market

Featuring over 40 unique shops & businesses from a leading art gallery, a high class butchers, florist & plant centre to craft studios, food shops and gifts with a difference. Along with the Crafty Potter Craft Cafe and much more, Heskin Farmers market is another great place to visit in the local area. Visit their website for their latest news and events. View Farmers Market

Martin Mere Wetland Centre

WWT Martin Mere is a wetland nature reserve managed by the Wildfowl and Wetlands Trust set in Tarlscough on the West Lancashire Coastal Plain. There you can step into a wilder world where wilderness and family-friendliness combine, giving visitors the chance to get close to fantastic wetland wildlife. View Martin Mere

image.title: crown green bowls
image.caption: Playing Bowls  Bowling With Copy Space

three_boxes.description:
Crown Green Bowls

Close to the village hall and the tennis club Mawdesley Bowling Club welcomes new players throughout the year. With meetings several days of the week there is always a warm welcome and a friendly face to greet you.

content.rendered:
With so much to do on-site at Stocks Hall, you couldn’t ask for a more welcoming, fun and friendly place to live. Whether you’re making new friends amongst the other residents or entertaining visitors, you’re never short of things to do in your new luxury home.

The communal lounges in the independent living apartments and residential care home are a real social hub. Residents have their own cinema where you can sit back and enjoy a classic movie or the latest blockbuster. When you’re in need of a little ‘me time’ why not spoil yourself at our on-site hair salon?

Coming soon in 2016 is the addition of a pool and a gym at our leisure suite, where you can also enjoy a spa treatment before rounding off the day with your favourite coffee in our cafe. Open to guests, family and friends, it’s a lovely way to spend time with those you love most.

acf.title: Two bed apartment Overview
acf.introduction:
Our luxury two bedroom apartments offer that little extra in space and comfort. The second bedroom can be used as you wish, for visiting guests or as a study or reading room.

Designed to meet your individual needs, you can select an open plan option or separate living room and kitchen, whichever best suits you. And with three different fixtures and fittings packages all included within the purchase price, you can move straight in when the time comes.

For added convenience, optional furniture ranges are also available, managed for you by the Stocks Hall Living team to help you create a real home.

bullet_points.bullet_point: Raised height electrical sockets to reduce bending
Raised height electrical sockets to reduce bending
Level access shower in addition to separate bath
Grab rails in shower and bath areas

acf.floorplan_title: Two bedroom luxury apartment floor plan

title_with_description.title: Living room
title_with_description.introduction: With a spacious open plan living and dining room there is plenty of space for several seating options. A small dining table can occupy an area of the room without encroaching on the living area, with space for both a sofa and chair.

title_with_description.title: Kitchen
title_with_description.introduction: All of the kitchen choices in our luxury apartments feature modern fixtures and fittings, along with a fitted oven, hob, fridge and freezer.  Easy grip lever taps on the sink and stainless steel door handles add a sense of luxury whilst remaining practical.

title_with_description.title: Main bedroom
title_with_description.introduction: Both bedrooms have ample space for a double bed and bedside tables for those evening essentials – a good book and your reading glasses. Space for a wardrobe and dressing table are the finishing touches for hotel chic living in the comfort of your own home.

acf.service_charge_introduction: A straightforward monthly service charge covers all your key essentials, as you can see from the list below.

service_charge_cover_list.list_item: Building Insurance – to all communal areas and private apartments
Cleaning and redecoration repairs and improvements – yo all internal and external communal areas
External maintenance – of the whole building and specifically to the individual private apartments
External Cleaning of window and internal cleaning of windows in the communal areas
Grounds and garden maintenance
Regular servicing and maintenance of lifts within the building
Regular servicing of internal and external CCTV & Security
Regular servicing of door access control / video phone
Freeview distributed television to private apartments and lounges
Provision of external telephone line to private apartments
Free inter building telephone calls with no limit
Free resident wi-fi available throughout communal areas
Use of private communal lounge
Water rates – to communal areas and private apartments
Electricity charges – to communal areas and private apartments (to a capped limit / additional use charged at current utility rates)
Underfloor heating
Removal of refuse and recycling to a central location
Provision for external storage and charging of mobility scooters
1 Reserved parking space
Contingency fund: To cover internal and external redecoration of communal areas

acf.optional_extras_title: Optional extras for complete peace of mind
acf.optional_extras_introduction:
Whilst luxury and thoughtful design work hand in hand to provide a beautiful home environment for all our residents, there’s even more to apartment living at Stocks Hall. As your needs change, we fully understand that you may need extra help and support in the comfort of your own home. With this in mind, we have in place a range of optional services to provide total peace of mind.

Fully qualified experienced care staff are on hand around the clock should you need them. Freshly cooked meals are available for delivery to your door. The peaceful haven of the leisure suite is always there to provide spa and health treatments. All this and much more is waiting for you to provide extra care and extra support as and when you need it most.

acf.title: A luxury take on independent living
acf.introduction:
Flexibly designed to meet your individual needs, you can select an open plan option or separate living room and kitchen, whichever best suits you. Better yet, there are three different fixtures and fittings packages to choose from too, all included within the purchase price.

For added convenience, optional furniture ranges are also available, managed for you by the Stocks Hall Living team to help you create a real home from home.

acf.floorplan_title: One bedroom luxury apartment floor plan

title_with_description.title: Living room
title_with_description.introduction: With a spacious open plan living and dining room there is plenty of space for several seating options. A small dining table can occupy an area of the room without encroaching on the living area, with space for both a sofa and chair.

title_with_description.title: Kitchen
title_with_description.introduction: The kitchen in our one bedroom apartments flows directly from the main living area. Featuring modern fixtures and fittings, along with a fitted oven, hob, fridge and freezer each of our kitchen choices come with everything you will need. Easy grip lever taps on the sink and stainless steel door handles add a sense of luxury whilst remaining practical.

title_with_description.title: Main bedroom
title_with_description.introduction: Our luxury master bedroom has ample space for a double bed and bedside tables for those evening essentials – a good book and your reading glasses. Space for a wardrobe and dressing table are the finishing touches for hotel chic living in the comfort of your own home.

acf.optional_extras_introduction:
Whilst luxury and thoughtful design work hand in hand to provide a beautiful home environment for all our residents, there’s even more to apartment living at Stocks Hall. As your needs change, we fully understand that you may need extra help and support in the comfort of your own home. With this in mind, we have in place a range of optional services to provide total peace of mind.

Fully qualified experienced care staff are on hand around the clock should you need them. Freshly cooked meals are available for delivery to your door. The peaceful haven of the leisure suite is always there to provide spa and health treatments. All this and much more is waiting for you to provide extra care and extra support as and when you need it most.

content.rendered:
At Stocks Hall, our residents are at the centre of everything we do. The people we employ – whether they are nurses, care assistants or managers – need to have a genuine interest in working with and helping the elderly. Compassionate, caring and fully qualified, we expect commitment in return for a truly rewarding career.

We’re proud to be a Gold Standard Investors in People employer who also has a Work Life Balance award to our name. So you can be sure that we look after you as much as we expect you to care for our residents.

acf.upload_your_cv_content:
We are always interested in hearing from people passionate to work with us so if you have seen a role that you like the look of then please select the job you want to apply for and attach your latest CV ( (Max 5M, doc, docx, pdf only).
Please select the job you want to apply for:

content.rendered:
Stocks Hall, a family-run company dedicated to the highest standards of care

Stocks Hall has been providing award-winning care home services since 1987. Today, our latest development in Mawdesley represents our family’s sixth care home in Lancashire. In each, the emphasis is on individual, personalised care supported by a belief in independence, mutual respect and wellbeing. A Gold Standard Investors in People employer, we’re committed to fostering positive relationships within the home and community to help build feelings of inclusion and belonging.

With a focus on excellence through honesty, innovation, diversity and trust, we aim to deliver an ever improving service by embracing change and building on the firm foundations we have established.

acf.full_width_box_content: The team here at Stocks Hall all have one thing in common – they put the people who choose to live with us at the centre of everything they do. With a genuine passion for caring for others, we search far and wide for the right people to make Stocks Hall Living such a great place to call home

three_boxes.title: Living here
three_boxes.description: At Stocks Hall Living in Mawdesley, care comes in a luxury wrapper. Find out what makes living here so special…

three_boxes.description: You will never be short of something to do here at Stocks Hall, from socialising with neighbours to taking part in an organised activity…
